intro: Boehmeria caudata var. pendula, commonly known as the hanging nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
